p: Alkaline phosphatase (ALP) is an enzyme produced mainly by the liver epithelium and osteoblasts (new bone-forming cells), this enzyme also comes from the intestine, proximal renal tubules, specifically in pregnant women, ALP is produced from the placenta. ALP is secreted through the bile duct. ALP may increase in blood serum when there is an obstacle in the bile duct (cholestasis). An abnormally elevated ALP level indicates liver or bone disease (Corathers 2006). If there is mild damage to the liver cells, ALP levels may rise, but it increases in acute liver disease.
